dialogues.text: As the man passes him, he looks at Mark and pulls up besi him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey you're Mark Bellison!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. So are you going to apologize?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The honking man speeds away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark sits in front of the gravesite of his grandmother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: Her tombstone which reads, "Martha Bellison 191 2007. Lived an average life for a woman in her time."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's really changed. I gave people the Man in the Sky, made myself rich and successful, told the world they can eat whatever they want and feel good about it. Everyone's happy but me. Because I'm the only one who knows it all... isn't. I made it all up. (PAUSE) You're not up there living in a mansion. You're right here. In the ground. That's all. And I'm the only one who knows that. (PAUSE) And the one thing I want I can't have. Because the world is too stupid to change. The world only cares about what they can see, and what they can know, and what they're used to and what... makes sense. No one listens to what they really want. And that's why I'll always just be a loser, grandma. And that's why I'll always be alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a beer bottle in his hand Mark searches through his kitchen drawers for a bottle opener. He opens a drawer an something catches his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: The envelope which reads, "MY INVENTION".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly Mark pulls it out of the drawer and stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of his front door opening startles him and Mark shoves the envelope into his back pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me. Can I come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer enters the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't seen you much lately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I've been busy with work and things. And I'm getting married. That's why I came over. To tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wedding is tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer pulls out an invitation, Mark waves it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you'll come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark shrugs and Jennifer puts the invitation back in her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No point really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would make me happy. Being around you makes me happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark turns towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So don't marry him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only have a few years to marry someone with good genes and financial stability so I can have children and the family I've always wanted. One day I'll be old and wrinkly and ugly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you won't. Not to me you won't. I love you. If you really love someone it doesn't matter what they look like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me this favor. Just one favor. Don't accept everything you see. Don't just do something because that's the way it's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're confusing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about what you want. Find out what you really want. And if it's not the same as what I want, well then I'll know that and I'll never darken your doorstep again. (PAUSE) I want you. What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer and Mark stare at each other for a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't. Will you just stay a little bit longer? I don't want to be alone. Just sit with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer nods. Mark leads her into the living room and th sit down far apart from each other on the couch. Mark tur the TV on and they both sit in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark has fallen asleep on the couch. Jennifer checks her watch and stands up. She takes out her wedding invitation lays it on the coffee table by Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She unfolds a blanket and is about to place it on him whe she notices an envelope sticking out of his back pocket. pulls it out and looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (READING) My invention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the letter and begins to read. Once finished, s folds up the letter and hurriedly leaves, scared and confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark wakes up and sees Jennifer's wedding invitation on t coffee table. He sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark stands before the mirror, dressed in a suit, putting a tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg pokes his head into the room, dressed in a suit as w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna be late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sign outside reads, "A QUITE PLACE TO THINK ABOUT THE IN THE SKY".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes sense people would start getting married at these places. I mean, who you marry decides who's mansion you're going to live in one day. It's a big decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small stage sits before a large stained glass window portraying Mark holding the two halves of the pizza box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob stands at the altar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark and Greg take their seats amidst a crowd of people sitting quietly in their chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer sits in a small room in a beautiful white dress, looking as beautiful as any woman has ever looked. She st absentmindedly out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a knock at the door. JENNIFER'S MOTHER pokes her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time, dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer doesn't answer. We PUSH IN on Jennifer to see sh clutching Mark's letter in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't feel all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? Do you have food poisoning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't think there's a word for what I have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Here's comes the Bride" plays over an organ and Jennifer walks down the aisle towards a smiling Rob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark watches her in awe, stunned by her beauty. Rob notic Mark staring at Jennifer and mouths "loser" at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer reaches the altar and stands across from Rob. Th WEDDING OVERSEER, an elderly man in a suit, stands betwee them holding a few sheets of paper in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are sitting here in this building today to share in the wedding of Rob and Jennifer. Two young, attractive people who have agreed that this union would be mutually beneficial and that their genetic match-up would most likely produce favorable offspring and a life of financial stability and physical security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both Rob and Jennifer nod at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob, do you promise to stay with Jennifer for as long as you want to and to protect your offspring for as long as you can?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer, do you promise to stay with Rob for as long as you want to and to protect your offspring for as long as you can?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Overseer) I'm sorry, hold on one second. (to Rob) Rob, can I ask you something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a slight hubbub in the room. Mark perks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONCERNED) Sure. But what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What color are my eyes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno... (LOOKING) Oh, they're brown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Jennifer's eyes. Indeed, they are brown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Rob, they're blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob looks again. Mark stirs in his seat, amazed by what h hearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, look at that. So they are. You've got pretty blue eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN on Jennifer. It works. Her mind is reeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we get on with this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer, do you promise to stay with Rob for as long as you want to and to protect your offspring for as long as you can?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer is confused. Her mind is fighting it, but she doesn't know what exactly she's fighting. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a sigh of relief from the room. Mark shakes his in sadness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before I pronounce these two man and wife, is there anyone here who thinks they'd offer either of these people a better genetic match-up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark bolts up in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole room gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come on. Look at you. You can't be better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I can. You've got shmuck genes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schmuck genes? What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I love her. (to Jennifer) Jennifer, don't marry him. Is this what you really want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. (pause; unsure) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark thinks this over for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. I'm done. Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awkwardly Mark makes his way to the aisle and leaves the room. The room is thick with tension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we married yet? Because I've got plans this afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark loosens his tie as he walks out of the building and towards the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background we can see the "church" door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SHOUTING) Hold on a minute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark turns, confused and tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer runs to him. She stands before him, they both st at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer pulls out Mark's letter and shows it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is any of it... the things you said... are they... I can't think of the word. (PAUSE) Is there a Man in the Sky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you say there was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I couldn't cope with the look on my grandmother's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how could you say something that... wasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure. I just did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what did you mean that I could grow old and ugly and still be beautiful to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean just that. You'll always be beautiful to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if my looks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. (PAUSE) Everything is so hard. Nothing is easy anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a long moment of silence. Jennifer moves closer Mark and looks directly into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want short, fat kids with little snub noses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The biggest smile we've ever seen comes across Mark's fac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy! That's an easy one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just   like she did the night on her couch, Jennifer reac over   and puts her hand on Mark's wrist. They both stare each   other for a long beat, holding hands, love beaming both   of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world is changing before their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does anyone else know about your invention?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But I'm sure it won't be long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we tell them right away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure. I don't think everyone will understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg sticks his head out of the church door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on out here? Everyone's just sitting in there. Are we gonna finish this wedding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer smiles at Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Praise the Man in the Sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE RISE UP as Mark and Jennifer walk hand in hand towards church -- and an unknowable future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world's last moment of honesty. A monumental occasion in the history of mankind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That lowly writer who stumbled upon the ability to lie went on to become one of the most important men of his age, married to one of the most beautiful women of his time, and passed on the lying gene to generations to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A world without honesty is a world with dreams. A world with pretense. A world with fiction. A world with flattery. And most importantly, a world with true love. Put simply, a world very much like our own.
